formulas.raw: Core relations Let \( w_b \) be unit weight of the selected bar (lb/ft or kg/m), \( L_i \) each cut length, and \( n_i \) its quantity. \[ L_{\text{total}}=\sum_i n_i\,L_i,\qquad W_{\text{total}} = w_b \times L_{\text{total}} \] Waste factor \( \alpha \% \) is applied multiplicatively: \[ L_{\text{with waste}} = L_{\text{total}}\,(1+\alpha/100),\quad W_{\text{with waste}} = W_{\text{total}}\,(1+\alpha/100) \] For stock splices in a continuous run of length \( L \) with stock length \( S \) and lap \( \ell \): \[ \text{pieces}=\left\lceil \frac{L}{S} \right\rceil,\quad \text{splices}=\max(0,\,\text{pieces}-1),\quad L_{\text{bar}} = L + \text{splices}\cdot \ell \]
